verses.verse: But it displeased <WH3415> <WH8799> Yonah <WH3124> exceedingly <WH1419> <WH7451>, and he was very angry <WH2734> <WH8799>.

And he prayed <WH6419> <WH8691> unto the YY <WH3068>, and said <WH559> <WH8799>, I pray <WH577> thee, O YY <WH3068>, was not this my saying <WH1697>, when I was yet in my country <WH127>? Therefore I fled <WH1272> <WH8800> before <WH6923> <WH8765> unto Tarshish <WH8659>: for I knew <WH3045> <WH8804> that thou art a gracious <WH2587> 'Elohim <WH410>, and merciful <WH7349>, slow <WH750> to anger <WH639>, and of great <WH7227> kindness <WH2617>, and repentest <WH5162> <WH8737> thee of the evil <WH7451>.
Therefore now, O YY <WH3068>, take <WH3947> <WH8798>, I beseech thee, my life <WH5315> from me; for it is better <WH2896> for me to die <WH4194> than to live <WH2416>.
Then said <WH559> <WH8799> the YY <WH3068>, Doest thou well <WH3190> <WH8687> to be angry <WH2734> <WH8804> ?

So Yonah <WH3124> went out <WH3318> <WH8799> of the city <WH5892>, and sat <WH3427> <WH8799> on the east side <WH6924> of the city <WH5892>, and there made <WH6213> <WH8799> him a booth <WH5521>, and sat <WH3427> <WH8799> under it in the shadow <WH6738>, till he might see <WH7200> <WH8799> what would become of the city <WH5892>.

And the YY <WH3068> 'Elohim <WH430> prepared <WH4487> <WH8762> a gourd <WH7021>, and made it to come up <WH5927> <WH8799> over Yonah <WH3124>, that it might be a shadow <WH6738> over his head <WH7218>, to deliver <WH5337> <WH8687> him from his grief <WH7451>. So Yonah <WH3124> was exceeding <WH1419> <WH8057> glad <WH8055> <WH8799> of the gourd <WH7021>.

But 'Elohim <WH430> prepared <WH4487> <WH8762> a worm <WH8438> when the morning <WH7837> rose <WH5927> <WH8800> the next day <WH4283>, and it smote <WH5221> <WH8686> the gourd <WH7021> that it withered <WH3001> <WH8799>.

And it came to pass, when the sun <WH8121> did arise <WH2224> <WH8800>, that 'Elohim <WH430> prepared <WH4487> <WH8762> a vehement <WH2759> east <WH6921> wind <WH7307>; and the sun <WH8121> beat <WH5221> <WH8686> upon the head <WH7218> of Yonah <WH3124>, that he fainted <WH5968> <WH8691>, and wished <WH7592> <WH8799> in himself <WH5315> to die <WH4191> <WH8800>, and said <WH559> <WH8799>, It is better <WH2896> for me to die <WH4194> than to live <WH2416>.

And 'Elohim <WH430> said <WH559> <WH8799> to Yonah <WH3124>, Doest thou well <WH3190> <WH8687> to be angry <WH2734> <WH8804> for the gourd <WH7021>? And he said <WH559> <WH8799>, I do well <WH3190> <WH8687> to be angry <WH2734> <WH8804>, even unto death <WH4194>.

Then said <WH559> <WH8799> the YY <WH3068>, Thou hast had pity <WH2347> <WH8804> on the gourd <WH7021>, for the which thou hast not laboured <WH5998> <WH8804>, neither madest it grow <WH1431> <WH8765>; which came up in a night <WH1121> <WH3915>, and perished <WH6> <WH8804> in a night <WH1121> <WH3915>:

And should not I spare <WH2347> <WH8799> Ninveh <WH5210>, that great <WH1419> city <WH5892>, wherein are <WH3426> more <WH7235> <WH8687> than sixscore <WH8147> <WH6240> thousand <WH7239> persons <WH120> that cannot discern <WH3045> <WH8804> between their right hand <WH3225> and their left hand <WH8040>; and also much <WH7227> cattle <WH929> ?
